name: nabeel84
text:
Old people are very technophobic. This strip proves it.

Cornelius has shown a weakness .

name: shenred
text: When you are the reigning (and only) champion of the Badass Games, you can flaunt your weaknesses in the open in order to allow everyone else to have the slimmest chance.

name: aplomb
text: A comment left by aplomb was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Dovey, Overmedicated, robotman, lamelliform, dickie_roxx, ConnorMc, Sortelli, shoethings, Zem, charchar)

name: gsail11
text: Cornelius is so badass he shows weakness by breaking something with a cricket bat.

name: madrin
text: it's classy, hey? a lesser man would have gone for the baseball bat. cliche, boring.

name: gmm
text: This comment would be about 25% more awesome if it was in Vlad. *TRANSLATE* "Is classy, no? Lesser man, he goes for baseball bat. Is cliche. Is boring."

text: this is true for everything

text: Is true for all thinks

text: chubby for being absolutely right.

text: A comment left by poing was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, Pseudochron, lamelliform, atticusonline, mrdavid, charchar)

name: sargasm
text: I disagree.  Teodor's logic has a hole in it:  Philippe does not need to leave the house to get buggered by Nolan.

name: trollcollins
text:
USB Bugger?

Just download any old driver for it. They're all the same.

name: gormster
text: iBugger.

name: steerpike66
text: Buggr

name: johnnyc
text: Bugg It!

name: belgand
text: bu.gg.er

name: tekende
text: /b/ugger

name: soticoto
text: No.

name: soticoto
text:
Teodor's logic also has another hole in it:

Cornelius didn't hit the computer; he hit the monitor.

name: semiquaver
text: And he also said fuck.  Clearly, Teodor is off his game lately.

name: laserblade
text: Could be a Mac.

name: soticoto
text: Macs aren't real computers.

name: laserblade
text: Nevertheless, a Mac could be pictured.  Looks like it could be one from when they had CRT screens.

name: mugi
text: AMEN AND HALLELUJAH

name: lateadopter
text: Cornelius fears nothing.  He was opposing the buggery of children, a problem that predates technology.  The computer was merely the pathway that the alleged bugger was using to enter the household.

name: lateadopter
text: Sorry, that should be buggerer.

name: honesttom
text: I've heard "bugger" used as a descriptive term for the buggerer, I think it's valid. Is "buggeree" a word yet?

name: coldfrog
text: it is now!

name: lateadopter
text: One can also use the past passive participle as a noun, as in "the buggered received no justice."

name: camrock
text: Not that I'm aware of, but "bugger" certainly is the correct, er, active noun, as in George V's reputed assertion "I won't knight buggers".

name: tripleg
text: catomite is a useful phrase in times such as these

name: spinynorman
text: A comment left by spinynorman was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by sharksarecoming, robotman, lamelliform, odei, elliotj, ghoti, Fcannon, gardenhead_, Zem)

text:
http://www.albinoblacksheep.com/text/bloodninja

If you didn't get the robe and wizard hat..

name: boredom_man
text: That, Phillipe, is the saddest thing.

name: saint
text: A comment left by saint was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by mr_lostman28, sharksarecoming, robotman, lamelliform, farqussus, DrSkradley)

name: saint
text: A comment left by saint was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by dayvancowboy, c_dizzle, scrumpton, charchar)

name: semiquaver
text: Actually we've been laming "He is five" for months. Guess some dudes just didn't pay attention.

name: atticusonline
text:
I dunno, maybe cause...we know he is five?

Try posting: "Philippe is an otter" and see what happens.

name: selbencoirlo
text:
"Comment rated 1 Chubbies and 0 Lames"
Apparently not much.

name: lolsworth
text: Oh, come on. Like anyone else would have got extravagently lamed for this. It's inoffensive at worst. Lame Saint when he's being an unpardonable douchenozzle, by all means, but case-by-case, people, case-by-case.

name: saint
text: Unpardonable douchenozzle is a fantastic descriptor, be it aimed at me or not.

name: lolsworth
text: See? He is being A Dude and not A Dick, and so I gave him a chubby. See how this works?

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
The word 'Dude' in Egyptian Arabic means camel dick.
I learned this from a fellow techie who was working with Cairo Support on a call, and happened to use it colloquially, thus terminating that call rather abruptly.
The joke was he implied that the Egyptian was a camel dick, except it was no joke.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: The other joke being that lolsworth thinks Set Dude and Set Dick are mutually exclusive, but in fact, they are not.

name: lolsworth
text: I always thought that was apocryphal. Something thirteen year olds tell each other. "HAY ARE YOU A COOL DUDE? HURRR YOU JUST SAID YOU WERE A DICK HA HA HA"

name: cousinted
text:
It isn't that Cornelius is computer illiterate, so much that he's filled with too much fiery rage to care if what he says makes any sense.

He is beating that computer old skool.

name: phthoggos
text: he is DEFINITELY not afraid of the fucking POLICE right now.

name: wittyname
text: I don't remember him drinking any Tequila...

name: falseprophet
text: THE MAN IS SO OLD SCHOOL HE HAS AN ADDING MACHINE THAT PRINTS ON PAPYRUS!

name: poing
text: What does this strip mean for Achewood's overall continuity?  Will the computer be making any future appearances?

name: featurelessvoid
text: This strip is a plot device to make way for the introduction of the Compy 386 next week.

name: drskradley
text: Cornelius does what we all should have done a long time ago.  The internet, truly, is a terrible thing.

name: poing
text: without the internet how would you get to feel the way you do by posting here

name: drskradley
text: I have ways.  Don't judge me, man.

name: saint
text: ...also wik.

name: tincanhitman
text: I would not call smashing a computer with a cricket bat to protect a child a weakness

name: postblank
text: I think it's fitting that pedophiles can only muster a buggering program in QBasic.  All flashing text marquee HTML website and Thomas MySpace editor script.

name: postblank
text: Uh-oh looks like I offended some Thomas's MySpace editor fans.

name: slab64
text:
I offered a Chubby to counteract. It's not that I liked your comment per se, just that I disagree that it deserves Lames.

See, my feelings above are marked NEU

name: benfromtenn
text: I just need to say that your avatar is freaking hypnotic.  Here I am, happily scrolling along, then your avatar falls under my gaze and the next thing I know my eyes have dried out, I've peed my pants, and it's dark outside.

name: slab64
text: Sounds like similar phenomena to the ones I experience when playing F.E.A.R., but for totally different reasons.

name: semiquaver
text: It's because you didn't seem to get the reference to old-school text adventure games.  Definitely not worth laming you for, though.

name: mr_lostman28
text:
I would like to thank this strip for making me look up cumulonimbus...

>look east
A bear sprays you with a tall dense cloud conisting of pepper and other eye irritants

name: shenred
text:
>attack bear
You are on the ground in the fetal position, weeping in a way that you hope will never be shown to the public. You are not in a position to fight. Also, he has a cricket bat.
>Wash eyes
Too late, you have been eaten by a grue.
GAME OVER
Your score: 3/153

name: dangelder
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: aperson
text: Nick Frost is great.

name: heeeraldo
text: oh la LA?

name: woodenteeth
text: oh GOD! so damn ADORABLE!

name: sagoon
text: A comment left by sagoon was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by mcowgill, lamelliform, mania3)

name: boredom_man
text: Welcome to the legal age of majority, my friend. You'll be using the word "litigious" a lot .

name: nutmeg
text: i had to look up caveat, emptor, and pederast, the last of which i realized i already knew, but assumed what i'd always heard was "preder-ass," a scathing term for the predator who is also an ass. however, the first two words are still a mystery to me.

name: boredom_man
text: It's a Latin phrase, and won't appear in dictionaries as English words but in Wikipedia as a phrase. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caveat_emptor

name: lateadopter
text: In lieu of Wikipedia, one could also provide the English translation:  "Buyer beware."

name: flazisismuss
text: When I was a kid there was a place we went to learn shit like that.  It was called school.  Kids these days.

name: clever-nickname
text: A comment left by clever-nickname was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by lamelliform, speedwell, spicyponyhead)

name: dropkickpikachu
text: Ain't nobody but the ancient Romans said their Vs like Ws. We do it Italian pronunciation style nowadays, fella. We don't take kindly to talkin' like dead people round these parts.

name: odei
text: Actually working class people in 19th century England generally substituted Vs for Ws too. But they didn't know Latin.

name: slab64
text: Also, the dudes from HIM talk like that as well. As I'm sure many of their fellow Nords do.

name: hearshot
text:
Ain't nobody but the ancient Romans said their Vs like Ws.

Well, nobody but the ancient Romans and Pavel Chekov.

name: anitrophaeron
text: A comment left by anitrophaeron was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Cyberbob, lamelliform, ohmygooses, gherittwhite)

name: sexualhomeboy
text: While the Declaration of Independence only explicates the right to pronounce lower-case f as s, the right to make other such letter substitutions is clearly implied.

name: lateadopter
text: D'oh! vs. Vade.

name: biff
text:
Problem is, it's not a lower case f. It strongly resembles a lower case f, but the cross bar doesn't stick out on both sides.

Look more closer.

name: sexualhomeboy
text:
Yeah, I know it's not an f. But whenever I look at one of those old documents, I can't help but think that people in that time must have had some sort of weird bottom-lip lisp, which I enjoy recreating while reading aloud. A carryover from childhood, when I didn't know it was not an f.

Am I the only one?

name: spicyponyhead
text:
it muft sizzle

No, I have no idea what you're talking about.

name: spicyponyhead
text: Actually, both of those are totally wrong.

name: belgand
text: Why am I the only one who doesn't have to look up these words and also uses them commonly in casual conversation?

name: ashoykh
text: achewood:  my cartoon and my word-of-the-day in one.

name: boscostacy
text: Emptorlingus: Buying things with the mouth.

name: sexualhomeboy
text: Caveatlingus:  morning breath.

name: lamelliform
text: Carp diem: fish of the day.

name: morelaak
text:
oh wow, it's been forever since Zork and the other text-based games of olden time.....

>look east
there is a child.

>bugger the child
you cannot bugger the child.

>gently bugger the child
you cannot gently bugger the child.

>twiddle the child
you cannot twiddle the child.

>cavort merrily with the child
you cavort merrily with the child. that child is named philippe, and he is five.

name: jrpigman
text:
You are likely to be buggered by a grue.

That's not about this strip, I'm just saying.

name: morelaak
text: alright. that's it. i commission someone from the achewood community to create an Achewood Text-Based Adventure.  Do it, and you, sir, win the internet.

name: flash1087
text: Damn it, I used to have a "Make Your Own Text Adventure" program saved...somewhere. Lemme see what I can do.

name: woodenteeth
text:
3 months have passed. You were supposed to have that on my desk by Monday morning.

Did you get that thing I sent you?

name: dropkickpikachu
text: You didn't know what a cumulonimbus was? Did you ever go to primary school? Is perhaps most basic meteorological idea.

name: tenthman
text: Cornelius is going to go all Chris Hansen on Nolan.  Luring him over, asking him why he came, reading awkward excerpts from his "e-buggery" aloud.  But then, he will do what Hansen never had the sand to do, make the pervert kiss the cricket bat.

name: twotonturkey
text: He already got all Ian Faith on the computer, I can only imagine what Nolan's head is going to look like if they ever meet.

name: misterkoss
text: I'm sure it will look like something one would find on the sort of websites Nolan tends to visit.

name: dougthehead
text: Leave it to Nolan to get turned on by his own head injury.

name: slab64
text: It will look like a stillborn tiger fetus.

name: the_prophet
text:
Give Connie a break, the man's (bear's) heart is in the right place.

That and one hell of a swing, hell fuck you up.

name: robotman
text: This is probably my favorite Achewood strip in the last year. Today should be a new holiday.

name: paperboy_2000
text: Yeah, this would probably make my "10 Best of 2007", too.  I can't think of too many strips where every panel made me bray like a donkey.

name: madnes
text: Wholeheartedly agree. I had to walk away from my computer upwards of two times to avoid laughing raucously (there are Serious Men nearby and my joy would not be well received)

name: atticusonline

name: johnnyc
text: A comment left by johnnyc was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Dovey, lawbot, HonestTom, robotman, lamelliform, Miku224, peterjoel, Orf)

name: nelsonater
text:
I'm glad that I'm not the only person who feels the urge to enshroud anything that goes bump in the night with a cumulonimbus of pepper spray. In fact, I recently purchased the "Family Size" of pepper spray from Sam's Club (for those of you who don't know what a Sam's Club is, think Wal-Mart, but everything is in bulk packaging).

I believe that the "Family Size" is not just a description of who can use it, but also what it can be used on. I no longer fear a pack of rabid wolves/bears/leprechauns whilst sleeping.

name: lateadopter
text: I thought everything at Wal-Mart was already in bulk packaging.  That's just me, I guess.  I went overseas for a few years, and when I came back I had changed from a Large to a Medium or a Small, even though I gained weight in the meantime.  Maybe I got denser.

name: madnes
text: Nifty! You can use the empty container as a baton :)

name: hellweek
text:
Panel 4 makes me feel like I'm reading Jerkcity for a moment.

YOU ARE IN A ROOM FILLED WITH RERUNS, EXITS ARE J)ERK AND L)ICK AND B)UGGERY

I'D LIKE TO GO SOUTHWEST (SW)

name: zem
text: GO PIT

text:
Oh son of a-- not a cumulonimbus! Usually it's just a cumulus humilis with the average rogue and scallywag.

Yeah I wiki'd cloud types, what of it?

name: lateadopter
text: Nolan may be a cartoon cat, but he is truly from the Internet.  There are some who do not exactly fear that day, unfortunately.

name: sizone
text: T's assertion in the last panel strikes me as oddly portentous. A liberal interpretation of a trade description act could easily find Potty Pals in the wrong.

name: bourbonsamurai

name: shoinan
text: Truly you have not yet lived.

name: honesttom
text: I've seen buggery and all its variants in one place before.

name: lawbot
text: I am disappointed with this strip. Cornelius' badassery has not born fruits.

name: nullzero
text: For some odd reason, I picture Nolan showing up to go to dinner with Philippe...but being intercepted by Pat and Rod Huggins at the door. Then, Nolan would be used as a plot device to take Rod Huggins out of the storyline for a indeterminable period of time.  Or, maybe he'll meet Lyle instead and feel that he had been played a fool

name: achilleselbow
text: You (and a ton of other people it seems) forget that Nolan has not yet been proven to be a pedophile and has no idea who Philippe is or that he is a child. He simply wanted to dine with whoever came up with the ingenious concept of Potty Pals.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: Nolan is merely professionally weird. He is, as I recall, one of three weirdo academics who loved Pat's music and sani-taco, although I am too lazy to provide a link to verify this.

name: blueloggy
text:
You know, I didn't expect too many chubbies on my comment, considering how most of the commenters on here seem to be 19-year-old boys and I was going with a 70's-housewife-cum-stand-up-comedienne vibe. But 3 Lames (so far)? What's up, internet?

I think maybe I am too soft for the internet.

name: boredom_man
text: What always astounds me about Acheword is how convincingly some of you play women & younger females. Good job, fellow 15-year-old suburban males! (And Pogo.)

text: Too soft for the internet? Sounds like my honeymoon!

name: belgand
text:
I wish I had ever had a chance to enjoy a placid afternoon of unhurried buggery. Or even a brief, tense coffee break of frantic, unsatisfying buggery. Basically what I'm saying is that I need to get my bugger on.

Hopefully I'll be able to use Flash to do it in the future though I suspect this will not be satisfying either.

You idiot Cornelius WAS NOT Buggered in prison okay
